entry.title: GitHub Mobile - Create pull request from existing branches [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Developers can now create a pull request directly from an existing branch on Mobile, making the workflow smoother between mobile and desktop to enhance productivity.

Expected Outcome

Users can review edited files and open a pull request from an existing branch anytime, anywhere. Simply tap the + button on the repository or pull request view, select a branch, review the code and create a pull request if everything looks good. You can then continue testing or making adjustments on the desktop, making the development process more flexible and efficient.

entry.title: Copilot Chat users can use Gemini Pro [GA]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

GitHub Copilot now supports a multi-model approach, allowing developers to choose from industry-leading models, including Google's Gemini Pro. This flexibility enables developers to select the most suitable model for specific tasks, enhancing their coding experience in Visual Studio Code and on github.com/copilot. By integrating multiple models, GitHub Copilot empowers developers to leverage the strengths of various AI models, optimizing code generation, refactoring, and overall development efficiency.

Customer Outcome

With the introduction of multi-model support in GitHub Copilot, developers can expect improved accuracy and efficiency in their coding workflows. The ability to toggle between different models ensures that developers can utilize the best-suited AI for their specific needs, leading to higher quality code and faster development cycles. This feature provides developers with greater control and customization, ultimately enhancing productivity and innovation in their projects.

entry.title: Copilot Chat users can use Gemini Pro [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

GitHub Copilot now supports a multi-model approach, allowing developers to choose from industry-leading models, including Google's Gemini Pro. This flexibility enables developers to select the most suitable model for specific tasks, enhancing their coding experience in Visual Studio Code and on github.com/copilot. By integrating multiple models, GitHub Copilot empowers developers to leverage the strengths of various AI models, optimizing code generation, refactoring, and overall development efficiency.

Customer Outcome

With the introduction of multi-model support in GitHub Copilot, developers can expect improved accuracy and efficiency in their coding workflows. The ability to toggle between different models ensures that developers can utilize the best-suited AI for their specific needs, leading to higher quality code and faster development cycles. This feature provides developers with greater control and customization, ultimately enhancing productivity and innovation in their projects.

entry.title: Copilot Chat users can use Claude Sonnet 3.5 [GA]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

GitHub Copilot now offers multi-model support, allowing developers to choose from industry-leading models, including Anthropic’s Claude 3.5 Sonnet, to power their coding assistance. This flexibility enables developers to select the most suitable model for their specific use case, ensuring optimal performance and efficiency. By integrating multiple models into familiar workflows in Visual Studio Code and on github.com/copilot, GitHub is enhancing the developer experience and providing tailored AI-powered solutions.

Customer Outcome

By leveraging GitHub Copilot's multi-model support, developers can expect increased productivity and improved code quality by selecting the best model for each task. This feature empowers developers to handle diverse programming challenges more effectively, resulting in faster development cycles and more robust software solutions. Additionally, the seamless integration of Anthropic’s Claude 3.5 Sonnet ensures that developers have access to advanced AI capabilities, enhancing their ability to tackle complex coding problems from concept to deployment.

entry.title: Dependencies on Issues
entry.content:
Value Prop

We are providing users with the ability to track dependencies across issues. You will be able to set, manage, and view dependencies in issues.

Expected Outcome

We have heard your feedback that dependencies are important for advanced planning and tracking purposes. We want to enable your teams to power up your workflows.

entry.title: GitHub Mobile - Fork Public Repositories [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Forking a public repository on Mobile allows developers to experiment safely, customize code, propose improvements, and create backups of their favorite projects anytime, anywhere.

Expected Outcome

You can now fork public repositories to your personal account anytime, anywhere. Simply tap the Fork button on the repository view, customize the name if needed, and you’re all set! Collaborate with others by editing code and proposing improvements directly from your mobile device, making it easier than ever to contribute to your favorite projects.

entry.title: Delegated alert dismissal for Code Scanning [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Delegated alert dismissal helps security teams with lower tolerance for risk by providing additional controls and visibility around alert dismissals. Enterprise teams with security, auditing, and compliance requirements can now control who can close alerts, when and how alerts can be closed, and who can approve this activity.

Expected Outcome

Delegated alert dismissal will 1) increase accountability across development teams when it comes to addressing alerts, 2) prevent insecure activity (e.g. mistakes or malicious action internally), and 3) improve the ability to manage alerts at scale, by making alert activity easier to govern.

entry.title: Delegated alert dismissal for code scanning [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Delegated alert dismissal helps security teams with lower tolerance for risk by providing additional controls and visibility around alert dismissals. Enterprise teams with security, auditing, and compliance requirements can now control who can close alerts, when and how alerts can be closed, and who can approve this activity.

Expected Outcome

Delegated alert dismissal will 1) increase accountability across development teams when it comes to addressing alerts, 2) prevent insecure activity (e.g. mistakes or malicious action internally), and 3) improve the ability to manage alerts at scale, by making alert activity easier to govern.

entry.title: Enterprise security manager [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

The new enterprise security manager role is designed to give your AppSec team comprehensive oversight across your entire enterprise—streamlining security management for large-scale organizations. Rather than manually configuring security settings for each individual organization, this role enables a single, centralized team to enforce security policies, monitor alerts, and access critical security data across all organizations in one unified view.

Additionally, this is a game-changer for GHES customers, who often manage security across dozens or even hundreds of organizations. By eliminating the need to set up security managers for each organization individually, the enterprise security manager role allows your team to oversee security operations across all organizations in the enterprise in just a few clicks—delivering faster, more consistent protection at scale.

Expected Outcome

Our enterprise customers have expressed a more streamlined way to empower their security-focused teams without the added complexity of adding a security manager team to each organization. Moreover, these teams often require access to enterprise-level policies and security settings, which traditionally have been reserved for the enterprise owner or granted only partially. This new role addresses these needs by providing:

  • Simplified, centralized access management across all organizations with just a few clicks.
  • Expanded permissions that encompass both organization-level and enterprise-level oversight and control.

entry.title: GitHub Copilot RAI: Advancing Responsible AI for Safer, Smarter Code Suggestions [GA]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

GitHub Copilot RAI introduces advanced Responsible AI (RAI) filters and user experience enhancements, ensuring that code completions are safe, relevant, and high-quality. By incorporating multi-class filtering, adversarial prompt benchmarks, and improved grounding evaluations, Copilot RAI significantly reduces false positives and harmful content in code suggestions. This empowers developers to receive accurate and trustworthy code completions, fostering a more secure and efficient coding environment.

Customer Outcome

With GitHub Copilot RAI, development teams can expect a substantial decrease in over-filtering and false positives, leading to more precise and relevant code completions. The enhanced filtering capabilities and adversarial prompt benchmarks will help developers maintain high standards of code quality and security. This results in a more streamlined and productive coding experience, allowing teams to focus on innovation while ensuring compliance with safety and ethical guidelines.

entry.title: Enterprise Roles, Permissions, Apps, and Teams [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

GitHub is creating a complete enterprise context that will simplify administration at scale and improve the experience managing user and integration access to multiple organizations. In this public preview we are granting access to several features in one experience:

  • Enterprise Custom Roles
  • Enterprise Fine-Grained Permissions (FGP)
  • Enterprise Teams
  • Enterprise Apps

All Enterprise-level features, current and future, will support the fine-grained permissions model, for both user roles and GitHub App installations. The result is that enterprise administrators can delegate their work safely to other users in their enterprise or GitHub Apps for automation.

Expected Outcome

We are enabling a least-privilege, custom role-based access control model that works well in multi-org enterprise deployments. Permissions are granular enough to let you grant access via roles, to teams and apps, that is no more than what is required to get a specific job done.

During this preview program we will continue to add more FGP and API coverage to comprehensively address needs for enterprise administration at scale. We expect that administrators will consolidate many organization teams to a more manageable set of enterprise teams deployed to multiple organizations. We want to see more enterprises, especially those with very large single organizations, take advantage of these features and create additional organizations to logically group their work.

entry.title: Copilot Extensions - GitHub Mobile [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Taking Copilot Extensions to GA expands access to all developers and organizations (with supported plan and account types) to build and use Copilot Extensions on GitHub Mobile, driving a more open, innovation-friendly ecosystem around GitHub Copilot. By moving beyond Public Preview, we aim to empower a broader developer community to create valuable, integrated tools, enhancing the utility and context of Copilot for users on GitHub Mobile.

Expected Outcome

The GA launch will expand developers' ability to stay productive on the go by making Copilot Extensions available on GitHub Mobile.

entry.title: Security campaigns with Copilot Autofix [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Security campaigns help users of GitHub Advanced Security rapidly reduce their backlog of application security debt. By leveraging Copilot Autofix to generate contextual explanations and code suggestions for up to 1,000 historical code scanning alerts at a time, security campaigns help developers and security teams collaborate to fix vulnerabilities with speed and confidence.

Expected Outcome

Using security campaigns, organizations can expect to effectively and rapidly remove their long-standing security debt through increased collaboration and engagement between security teams and devs and the application of Copilot Autofix capabilities at scale.

entry.title: Generated SDKs for Go and .NET [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

The fully generated SDKs for Go and .NET will be released in general availability (GA). This follows the preview version that GitHub introduced several months ago in the blog post Our Move to Generated SDKs. In this release, the SDKs will be production-ready and offer significant enhancements:

  • Broader API support: Easily access more GitHub API endpoints than with previous SDKs.
  • Automatic rate limit management: Avoid exceeding API rate limits with built-in adjustments based on HTTP response headers.
  • Simplified authentication: Easily authenticate as a GitHub App, enabling finer-grained permissions and higher primary API rate limits for Enterprise Cloud accounts.

Expected Outcome

By adopting the GA generated SDKs for Go and .NET, teams will be more productive at integrating with GitHub using expanded and up-to-date API support, enjoy more stable integrations with automatic rate limit handling, and leverage higher rate limits and fine-grained security controls through simplified GitHub App authentication.

entry.title: Secret scanning scan history is surfaced in the REST API, audit logs, and webhooks [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

A new API endpoint will surface a repository's secret scanning scan history, providing information on backfill scans for different content types and patterns, as well as the latest incremental scan. The audit log and webhooks will have a new event when a backfill scan is completed in a repository.

Expected Outcome

Scan history information gives security teams insight into the secret scanning activity in their repositories and assurance that scans are running as expected.

entry.title: Multi-gpu and larger vRAM GPU runners [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

GitHub hosted GPU runners now offer expanded sizing and GPU card options. With this release we are adding 4 new GPU skus to our hosted runner fleet. These runners offer more vCPUs, multi-gpus and larger vRAM for customers that need more power and the ability to test across multiple GPUs.

Expected Outcome

Pipelines that need a more powerful GPU card for testing, need to test across multiple gpus, or require a larger amount of vRAM, can utilize these new GPU runner skus to run natively within Actions.

entry.title: Copilot Model Picker [GA]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

The Copilot Chat Model Picker allows developers to choose from a variety of industry-leading models, including GPT-4o, o1, Claude, and Gemini - directly within their preferred development environments such as VS Code, Visual Studio, JetBrains IDEs, and GitHub.com. This flexibility empowers developers to select the best-performing model for their specific tasks, enhancing the quality of Copilot Chat responses. Additionally, early adopters can experiment with the latest models as soon as they are released, staying ahead of the competition and driving innovation within their teams.

Customer Outcome

By leveraging the Copilot Chat Model Picker, development teams can expect increased engagement and satisfaction as they tailor their Copilot Chat experiences to fit their unique needs. Organizations will see a rise in daily active users utilizing the model picker, leading to higher adoption rates and improved customer satisfaction. Early adopters will benefit from immediate access to cutting-edge models, enabling them to experiment and innovate more rapidly within their familiar development environments. Overall, this feature will contribute to a more customizable and efficient development workflow.

entry.title: Copilot Extensions [GA]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

The GitHub Copilot Extensibility Platform enables both first-party and third-party developers to enhance Copilot’s capabilities by integrating external tools and data sources directly into the development workflow. This lets users perform complex, orchestrated tasks beyond code and text generation, bringing external tools right into Copilot Chat. With extensions in GA, developers can rely on improved platform stability, clear support SLAs, OIDC support, transparent messages about data access limits, and availability across new environments like Mobile and JetBrains(with more to come).

Customer Outcome

As Copilot Extensions move into GA, developers and organizations can now tailor Copilot’s capabilities to fit their unique tech stack, boosting productivity across teams. Admins can control over which GitHub organization and repository data is accessible to extensions through app authorizations, with transparent messages around permission gates. Organizations can also build and share private, enterprise-grade extensions, ensuring consistency and streamlined workflows across teams and projects. This enables secure, efficient task automation and context retrieval, cutting down research time and accelerating developer velocity.

entry.title: Secret scanning: non-provider patterns - [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Non-provider patterns are generic detectors that help you uncover secrets outside of patterns tied to specific token issuers, like HTTP authentication headers, connection strings, and private keys.

Expected Outcome

Non-provider patterns give security teams broader visibility into any secrets leaked in their repositories.

entry.title: Delegated alert closures for secret scanning [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Delegated alert closures help security teams with lower tolerance for risk by providing additional controls and visibility around alert closures. Enterprise teams with security, auditing, and compliance requirements can now control who can close alerts, when and how alerts can be closed, and who can approve this activity.

Expected Outcome

Delegated alert closures will 1) increase accountability across their development teams when it comes to addressing alerts, 2) prevent insecure activity (e.g. mistakes or malicious action internally), and 3) improve ability to manage alerts at scale, by making alert activity easier to govern.
